Crockpot Chicken Fajitas

Jump to Recipe

If you're looking for an easy and delicious way to bring the vibrant flavors of Mexican cuisine into your home, look no further than this Crockpot Chicken Fajitas recipe. Perfect for busy weeknights, this dish combines tender chicken breasts with colorful bell peppers and onions, all seasoned to perfection with a zesty fajita blend. Whether you’re meal prepping for the week or hosting a cozy family dinner, this recipe is a crowd-pleaser that requires minimal effort thanks to the slow cooker. With just a handful of ingredients and a little bit of patience, you can enjoy mouthwatering fajitas that are both healthy and satisfying, sure to become a staple in your cooking repertoire. Serve them in warm tortillas and top them off with your favorite fixings like sour cream and shredded cheese for an unforgettable meal that brings everyone to the table. Read on to discover how to easily whip up this delightful dish and experience the joy of homemade fajitas!

Ingredients

chicken breasts

Choose boneless, skinless chicken breasts for easier shredding and a more tender texture. If you're looking for a lower-fat option, chicken thighs can be used instead, but they may have a slightly different flavor and texture.

bell peppers (mixed colors)

Using a mix of red, yellow, and green bell peppers not only adds color but also a range of flavors. If fresh bell peppers aren't available, you can use frozen ones; just toss them in without thawing to avoid excess moisture.

onion

Yellow onions work well for a sweet, caramelized flavor, but you can substitute with red onions for a sharper taste or even shallots for a milder flavor. Sautéing the onions before adding them to the crockpot can enhance their sweetness.

fajita seasoning

If you don't have pre-made fajita seasoning, mix your own using chili powder, cumin, garlic powder, and paprika. You can also adjust the spice level by adding cayenne pepper or red pepper flakes.

olive oil

Extra virgin olive oil provides a rich flavor, but you can substitute with canola oil or avocado oil if you prefer a higher smoke point or a neutral flavor. If you're looking to cut calories, you can reduce the amount or omit it, but this might slightly alter the texture.

salt

Start with a small amount and adjust to taste after cooking, as the fajita seasoning and any additional toppings may also contain salt. For a different flavor, consider using kosher salt or sea salt.

black pepper

Freshly ground black pepper enhances the flavor better than pre-ground. If you want a bit of heat, try adding freshly cracked black pepper or even a pinch of cayenne.

tortillas

Flour tortillas are soft and pliable, perfect for wrapping; however, corn tortillas are gluten-free and add a nice texture. You can lightly toast them on a skillet for added flavor.

sour cream (optional)

Sour cream adds creaminess and tang; for a healthier option, consider Greek yogurt. You can also enhance it with lime juice or a sprinkle of taco seasoning.

shredded cheese (optional)

Cheddar is a classic choice, but you can use Monterey Jack for a milder flavor or Pepper Jack for some spice. Consider adding a sprinkle of queso fresco for an authentic touch.

Cooking Steps

  • Step 1: Prepare the Vegetables

    Start by slicing the bell peppers and onion into thin strips. Use a variety of colored bell peppers (red, green, yellow) for a vibrant dish. This not only enhances the visual appeal but also adds different flavors.

  • Step 2: Layer the Chicken in the Crockpot

    Place 2 pounds of chicken breasts at the bottom of your crockpot. Ensure they're laid flat for even cooking.

  • Step 3: Add Vegetables on Top

    Evenly distribute the sliced bell peppers and onions over the chicken breasts. This helps to infuse the chicken with flavor as it cooks.

  • Step 4: Season the Ingredients

    Drizzle 2 tablespoons of olive oil over the chicken and vegetables. Then, sprinkle 2 tablespoons of fajita seasoning, along with salt and black pepper to taste. Make sure to mix everything slightly to ensure even distribution of the seasonings.

  • Step 5: Cook the Fajitas

    Cover the crockpot with its lid. Set it to cook on low for 6 hours or on high for 3 hours. The chicken should be fully cooked, reaching an internal temperature of 165°F (75°C) and easily shreddable.

  • Step 6: Shred the Chicken

    Once cooked, remove the chicken breasts and shred them using two forks. Then, mix the shredded chicken with the peppers and onions in the crockpot to combine all the flavors.

  • Step 7: Serve the Fajitas

    Warm up 8 tortillas in a pan or microwave. Serve the chicken mixture in the tortillas and top with optional ingredients like sour cream and shredded cheese for added creaminess and flavor.

Frequently Asked Questions

How do I prepare chicken breasts for cooking?

Start by rinsing the chicken breasts under cold water and patting them dry with paper towels. Trim any excess fat or gristle with a sharp knife. You can leave them whole or cut them into strips for quicker cooking, but for this recipe, you'll place them whole in the crockpot.

What is fajita seasoning and how can I make my own?

Fajita seasoning is a blend of spices commonly used to flavor fajitas. You can buy it pre-made or make your own by mixing 1 teaspoon each of chili powder, cumin, garlic powder, onion powder, paprika, and salt. Adjust to your taste!

What types of bell peppers should I use?

You can use any color of bell peppers (green, red, yellow, orange) or a mix for a vibrant dish. They all provide a sweet flavor and colorful presentation!

How can I tell if the chicken is cooked through?

The safest way to check if chicken is cooked is to use a meat thermometer. The internal temperature should reach 165°F (75°C). If you don’t have a thermometer, the chicken should be white throughout with no pink in the center.

What if I don't have a crockpot?

If you don’t have a crockpot, you can cook this dish in a slow cooker on the stovetop or in a covered pot on low heat in your oven. Just make sure to monitor it closely and adjust the cooking time as needed.

How can I safely shred the chicken?

Once the chicken is cooked, use two forks to pull the chicken apart. Hold one fork in each hand and pull the chicken in opposite directions. Be careful, as the chicken will be hot!

What are some good toppings for my fajitas?

Some popular toppings include sour cream, shredded cheese, guacamole, salsa, and fresh cilantro. You can also add sliced jalapeños or avocado for extra flavor!

How can I warm tortillas without them breaking?

To warm tortillas, you can wrap a stack in aluminum foil and place them in a preheated oven at 350°F (175°C) for about 10-15 minutes. Alternatively, you can heat them in a dry skillet over medium heat for 30 seconds on each side.

What should I do with leftovers?

Store any leftover chicken fajitas in an airtight container in the fridge for up to 3-4 days. You can reheat them in a skillet or microwave before serving.

How do I know when to season my dish?

It's best to season as you go! Start with the fajita seasoning and adjust salt and pepper to taste. You can always add more, but it's hard to fix an overly salty dish.

Additional Information

Dietary Considerations

This dish can easily accommodate various dietary preferences. For gluten-free options, serve the chicken and vegetables in lettuce wraps instead of tortillas. To make it dairy-free, omit the sour cream and cheese, or use plant-based alternatives. For a lower-carb option, serve the fajita mixture over a bed of sautéed zucchini noodles or cauliflower rice.

Pairings

For a well-rounded meal, serve the Crockpot Chicken Fajitas with a side of Mexican rice or refried beans. For beverages, consider pairing with a light lager beer, a crisp Sauvignon Blanc, or a refreshing margarita. You can also serve a zesty lime-infused sparkling water for a non-alcoholic option.

Serving Suggestions

Serve the Chicken Fajitas in warm tortillas, allowing diners to customize their own fajitas. Provide a variety of toppings such as diced tomatoes, sliced jalapeños, avocado slices, cilantro, and lime wedges. For a festive touch, arrange the toppings in small bowls on a platter for a colorful presentation. Consider garnishing the dish with fresh cilantro for added flavor and visual appeal.

#

Crockpot Chicken Fajitas

370 min
$15
350 kcal
Difficulty: 20%
Servings: 4

Dietary Tags:

Gluten-FreeDairy-Free

Cuisine:

Mexican

Course:

Main Course

Tags:

easyslow cookerMexicanhealthy

Description

Juicy chicken with vibrant bell peppers and spices, all cooked to perfection in a easy slow cooker.

Ingredients

  • chicken breasts: 2 pounds
  • bell peppers (mixed colors): 3
  • onion: 1
  • fajita seasoning: 2 tablespoons
  • olive oil: 2 tablespoons
  • salt: to taste
  • black pepper: to taste
  • tortillas: 8
  • sour cream (optional): for serving
  • shredded cheese (optional): for serving

Date Created:

11/22/2024
